meanings.definition: Having or showing fine personal qualities or high moral principles.
meanings.sent1: The knight displayed noble behavior by helping the poor.
meanings.sent2: She admired his noble actions towards others.
meanings.sent3: It was noble of him to share his lunch with a hungry squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her noble heart shone brightly in the darkness of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The noble deed left a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.definition: Of an exalted moral or mental character or excellence.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's noble words inspired the students to do their best.
meanings.sent2: His noble thoughts guided him to make the right decision.
meanings.sent3: It was noble of the cat to share its toy with the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her noble mind soared above the petty arguments.
meanings.sent5: The noble idea sparked a revolution in their thinking.

meanings.sent1: The castle stood tall and noble against the setting sun.
meanings.sent2: The noble statue in the park attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent3: It was noble of the mountain to wear a crown of clouds.
meanings.sent4: The noble oak tree commanded respect in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The noble ship sailed majestically across the vast ocean.
